intro: Tagetes subvillosa, commonly known as the Mexican marigold or narrowleaf marigold, is a species of flowering plant in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and aromatic properties. Tagetes subvillosa is also known for its ability to repel certain pests, making it a valuable addition to gardens.
